@ENERGIE_FIN: Who said it was corrupt? Poweriso?

Thank you so much! Great game and it works perfect for me. Had no problems at all. I enjoyed the extras you added to the package and the updates that were included were very convenient. The Key Generator gave me a valid and completely working CD Key for the install. However... At first, I noticed I was not able to play in online (multiplayer) mode because it gave me an "Invalid Key" error when I tried to connect to servers. But, as a tip for any people here ready to download this... You can get your CD Key to become authentic and play online! Heres a simple easy step I ended up figuring out. In your main folder after you've downloaded the game, open CRACK & KEYGEN and then update + crack. Then open your RETURN.TO.CASTLE.WOLFENSTEIN folder and open the "rtcw" file, it's a Registry (.reg) file. If you get a Registry Editor alert asking you if you would like to continue, click yes to allow the entry to be added to your registry. That's it! You're all done, go enjoy a good online battle!
Oh and, this game is virus and threat free, nice and clean.



I would recommend using PowerISO to open your game folder like the publisher recommends. It's a really convenient program. It has cool features to easily allow you to extract the files to somewhere and to burn a copy of the game to a CD or DVD. You can even create a virtual drive and send the game to it like you have your game disc inserted and ready to install. You can download it at www.poweriso.com for FREE. With the free version, you get a 300 MB limitation though. Use this information to unlock the FULL version like I did. Username: Michael | Serial: H258V-QW4LN-RBFK2-X569E-PCJ8E



ENJOY!!!! =D

Yes the multiplayer works, but make sure you DONT patch up to 1.4b because you can only play on like 2 servers there. 

Only patch up to 1.1 then you can play on like half of the servers there. If you want hitsounds or configs, scripts and more visit www.etconfig.com

Ok, a correction:

Not 
"3. Run AUTORUN from image/disk and install. Use the key you just wrote down", 
correct is
"3. Run SETUP from image/disk and install. Use the key you just wrote down."
I clicked on Autorun, and nothing. Setup worked.
